abstracts.cdata!:
The Second Lesotho National Development
            Corporation (LNDC) Project was achieved. The Bank was
            accommodating. A major flexibility that enhanced increased
            commitment was the banks approval for the factory shell
            program which provided the investor with the basic
            motivation to accelerate investment decisions. During the
            period of the project the Bank carried out regular
            supervisory missions characterized by constructive dialogue
            between the Bank and LNDC. LNDC's performance in
            achieving the objectives of the second line of credit
            represent an improvement over performance of the first
            credit facility. During the first four years of the second
            credit line, the Corporation's performance was
            admittedly poor in terms of commitments, disbursements and
            project approvals however. this trend was dramatically
            reversed when economic fortunes turned around, and when the
            International Development Association (IDA) consented to new
            approvals to the utilizations of the credit line. The
            project was therefore well conceived and in line with the
            main problems and priorities of the industrial sector.
